intro: Cynoglossum cheirifolium subvar. arundanum, commonly known as the Persian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens. This subspecies is closely related to other members of the Cynoglossum genus, which are known for their showy blooms and medicinal properties.
